summary: Completed testing of P0 Features: SEO Network Usage in Asset Domains + Domain Search Auto-Suggest in SEO Networks. All 9 backend tests passed (100%). All frontend features verified working.

search_endpoint: Search results are grouped by domain
seo_networks_field: Asset domains have seo_networks array field
seo_networks contains network_id, network_name, role, optimized_path
Unused domains have empty seo_networks array

asset_domains_page: SEO Networks column visible in Asset Domains table
Network badges show network name with icon
Main role badges have green color
Supporting role badges have purple color
Badges are clickable and navigate to /groups/{network_id}
Domains with 2 networks show both badges (moneysite.com)
seo_networks_search: Search input present with placeholder 'Search domains or paths...'
Each result shows: path, role (Main/Support), network_name
Clicking row highlights matching networks in list
'N highlighted' badge shows with 'Clear filter' link

critical_code_review_comments: Backend search endpoint uses efficient MongoDB aggregation pipeline
Brand scoping properly enforced in search via get_user_brand_scope()
seo_networks field populated via batch aggregation (performant for large datasets)
Frontend SeoNetworksBadges component properly handles 0, 1, 2, and >2 networks
+N more tooltip implemented but not triggered (no test data with >2 networks per domain)
Debounced search (350ms) prevents excessive API calls
Highlight feature properly dims non-matching networks
seed_data: Existing test data used: moneysite.com (2 networks), tier1-site*.com (TESTER2), tier2-site*.com (Project A). Domains without networks show '—'.
context_for_next_testing_agent: P0 Features fully tested: 1) Asset Domains page now has SEO Networks column with clickable badges showing network name+role, 2) SEO Networks page has domain search with auto-suggest dropdown showing domain→path→role→network, 3) Search results support two actions: 'Open' navigates to network detail, clicking row highlights matching networks. Backend uses MongoDB aggregation for both features.
